result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J Haluska was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IMPOSED & STAYED.  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$250 DNA surcharge + court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with ML or her family & not be at her residence or employment.
Drug Treatment Court.  Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas J Haluska

records.addlTxt: Ct ordered zero restitution
From DOC regarding clarification on DNA surcharges.

Defendant appeared with Attorney Jeff Nichols. Ismael Ozanne appeared for the State. James Pearson appeared for JMH. State moved for termination. Attorney Nichols requested setover; Court decided to continue with termination hearing. Defendant made statement. Court terminated defendant's involvement in drug court program. Files to be sent to trial branch for scheduling.

Reporter:  digital recorder - 1:34
Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail continued.
Defendant in court with Attorney Denis R Vogel.  Emily Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.
Status conference on May 19, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to release.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant has been referred to the Drug Court Program
  Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant in court with Attorney Denis R Vogel.  Lanny B Glinberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
